title: ag.algebraic geometry - On $G$-gerbes over the punctured disk
body: Let $G$ be a finite (not necessarily abelian) group and let $\mathcal{X}\to D^*$ be a $G$-gerbe over the punctured disk $D^*$. Is there a finite etale cover $D^*\to \mathcal{X}$? I think of $G$-gerbes as higher analogues of $G$-torsors. If $X\to D^*$ is a $G$-torsor, then $X$ is in fact isomorphic to $D^*$ and the morphism $X\to D^*$ is given by $z\mapsto z^e$ for some $e\geq 1$. Is there a similar picture for $G$-gerbes? (I should stress that I assume $\mathcal X$ and $X$ to be connected.) ag.algebraic-geometry complex-geometry stacks complex-manifolds gerbes Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Jan 10, 2019 at 16:47 Praphulla Koushik 6,223 3 3 gold badges 29 29 silver badges 74 74 bronze badges asked May 26, 2017 at 18:47 Porto Vino 11 1 1 bronze badge $\endgroup$ 5 $\begingroup$ Are there any nontrivial gerbes over $D^*$ at all? (For $G$ abelian there are none) $\endgroup$ Piotr Achinger –  Piotr Achinger 2017-05-26 18:56:07 +00:00 Commented May 26, 2017 at 18:56 $\begingroup$ I thought that there were non-trivial $G$-gerbes, as there are non-trivial $G$-torsors. Maybe my expectation was too naive? $\endgroup$ Porto Vino –  Porto Vino 2017-05-26 19:04:05 +00:00 Commented May 26, 2017 at 19:04 6 $\begingroup$ Torsors under $G$ correspond to $H^1(D^*, G) = {\rm Hom}(\pi_1(D^*), G) = G$, while gerbes correspond to $H^2(D^*, G)$, which is zero (at least for abelian groups). $\endgroup$ Piotr Achinger –  Piotr Achinger 2017-05-26 19:33:05 +00:00 Commented May 26, 2017 at 19:33 $\begingroup$ @PiotrAchinger Let $L$ be a band. (These are classified by $H^1(D^*,Out(G))$, so this set can be non-trivial. Take for example a group $G$ with $Out(G) = \mu_n$.) The set of $G$-gerbes with band $L$ is (when non-empty) a torsor under the trivial group $H^2(D^*,Z(G))$. The latter is trivial by your remark. So, up to the choice of a (possibly non-trivial?) band, all $G$-gerbes are trivial. Does that sound right? $\endgroup$ Porto Vino –  Porto Vino 2017-05-27 09:22:36 +00:00 Commented May 27, 2017 at 9:22 $\begingroup$ @PortoVino topologically, at least, such gerbes on the punctured disk should correspond to $pi_1$ of a certain classifying space, namely the classifying space of the crossed module $\mathop{Ad}\colon G\to \mathop{Aut}(G)$. I think in this case ($G$ discrete) that $pi_1 = \mathop{Out}(G)$ $\endgroup$ David Roberts –  David Roberts ♦ 2019-01-11 02:35:47 +00:00 Commented Jan 11, 2019 at 2:35 Add a comment  |  0 Sorted by: Reset to default Highest score (default) Date modified (newest first) Date created (oldest first) You must log in to answer this question.
